commands.title: Command Reference
commands.subtitle: All mneme commands with detailed usage

commands.name: /init-mneme
commands.description: Initialize mneme in the current project
commands.details: Creates the .mneme/ directory structure with required files. Run this once per project before using other commands.

commands.name: /mneme:save
commands.details: Extracts and persists: interactions (to local.db), summary, decisions, patterns, rules. Run anytime during or after a session.

commands.name: /mneme:resume
commands.details: Restores context from a previous session. Omit the ID to see a list of recent sessions.

commands.name: /mneme:search
commands.details: Searches sessions and approved units using full-text search.

commands.name: /mneme:harvest
commands.details: Extracts rules, patterns, and decisions from GitHub PR review comments.

items.question: What data is shared with my team?
items.answer: Only JSON files in .mneme/ are shared via Git. The local.db file (containing conversation history) is gitignored and stays private.

items.question: How does auto-search work?
items.answer: On each prompt, mneme extracts keywords and searches sessions and approved units. Relevant matches are injected as context.

items.question: When should I run /mneme:save?
items.answer: Run it after important work or before ending a long session. Interactions are auto-saved at session end; source knowledge extraction requires /mneme:save.

items.question: Can I use mneme across multiple projects?
items.answer: Yes. Each project has its own .mneme/ directory. The dashboard can browse any project's mneme data.

items.question: What happens during auto-compact?
items.answer: When context reaches 95%, Claude Code auto-compacts. mneme's PreCompact hook backs up interactions to SQLite first, preserving full history.

items.question: How do I find old sessions?
items.answer: Use the dashboard or /mneme:search with keywords. Sessions are stored in .mneme/sessions/YYYY/MM/.

items.question: What's the difference between resume and search?
items.answer: /mneme:resume restores full session context for continuation. /mneme:search finds specific information without restoring context.

items.question: How are decisions extracted?
items.answer: During /mneme:save, Claude analyzes the conversation for technical decisions, extracting the choice, reasoning, alternatives, and outcome.

items.question: Can I edit decisions?
items.answer: Yes. Decision files are JSON in .mneme/decisions/. You can edit them directly or through the dashboard.

items.question: How do decisions affect future sessions?
items.answer: Relevant decisions are auto-injected when similar topics arise, ensuring consistency and avoiding repeated discussions.

items.question: mneme commands are not working
items.answer: Ensure mneme is initialized with /init-mneme. Check that .mneme/ directory exists with the required structure.

items.question: Auto-search is not finding relevant content
items.answer: Try running /mneme:save more frequently to capture knowledge. Use specific keywords when searching.

items.question: Dashboard shows no data
items.answer: Ensure you're running the dashboard from the project directory with .mneme/. Check that sessions have been saved.

items.question: Interactions are not being saved
items.answer: Interactions are saved at session end by the SessionEnd hook. Ensure hooks are properly configured in hooks.json.
